assumptions: defect partition sector expansion is valid at the required order
two-defect occupancy retains the 1/2! combinatoric factor
there are g=5 discrete defect channels contributing in the two-defect sector
delta2_derivation.note: δ₂=(5/4)·δ_top² (discrete multiplicity g=5; no continuous fit parameter)

spec.determinism: Deterministic given TFPT constants and the fixed δ₂ model.
gaps: Publication-grade requires a first-principles topological/QFT derivation of the discrete multiplicity (g=5).
inputs: TFPT invariants (c3, varphi0_tree, delta_top) from tfpt_suite/constants.py
spec.name: Defect partition derivation (derive δ₂ without fitting)
objective: Turn the δ₂ term from a debug target into an assumption-explicit discrete derivation candidate.
Provide a clear audit trail for why δ₂ is not a free parameter.
outputs: δ₂ derivation record (model_id, assumptions, δ₂ value)
diagnostic α^{-1}(0) value implied by the δ₂ candidate (strict z-score vs CODATA)
spec.question: Can the next defect-sector correction δ₂ be generated from discrete defect combinatorics (not fitted), while improving α(0) metrology?
validation: δ₂ is produced by a discrete model choice (no continuous knob).
α^{-1}(0) implied by the δ₂ candidate is within 5σ of CODATA (strict σ) as a metrology gate.
